text:
I couldn't pick 2.4.7 from the list so I picked 2.4.6 although this issue is happening with 2.4.7, apr 1.5.0 and apr-util 1.5.3.

While trying to build httpd using --with-included-apr, I get the following error:

tools/gen_test_char > include/private/apr_escape_test_char.h
/bin/sh: include/private/apr_escape_test_char.h: No such file or directory
make[4]: *** [include/private/apr_escape_test_char.h] Error 1
make[4]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....


I had no issues compiling 2.4.6 with apr 1.4.8 and apr-util 1.5.2.
creator: nlopes.ml@gmail.com
trawick@apache.org
text:
By chance is this an out of tree build?

Please try this patch and see if it helps:

http://mirror.sdunix.com/apache//apr/patches/apr-1.5.0-out-of-tree-build.patch

(It fixes a problem where the include/private directory may not yet exist at the point where your build failed.)

creator: trawick@apache.org
text: (also need 1.5.0 added for apr, in addition to 2.4.7 for httpd)

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
Fixed in 1.5.1...
Patch available for 1.5.0 (referred to in release announcement)...
